III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or
otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm
to a youth
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 threatened youth with physical harm.
Investigation The complainant for these allegations was anonymous, so no
additional information was collected.
Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 12/12/2023. Youth A stated he has had
issues with Supervisor 1 but none that rose to the level of any
safety concerns. Youth A stated he had filed a grievance on
Supervisor 1 a month prior, regarding issues with concerns about
Supervisor 1 being unfair with snacks. Youth A stated he has
heard Supervisor 1 get upset with other youth in the program, but
never to the point of threatening them or stating anything
resembling “I’m going to slam your head into a wall.”
Youth B was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 12/12/2023. He stated Supervisor 1 has a
“cool” temperament and he has never stated anything that
appeared to be a threat towards any youth.
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3, and
Supervisor 4, and Supervisor 5 were all interviewed separately
during a face-to-face, announced visit to the facility on
01/04/2024. All staff had similar work experiences with Supervisor
1 in that they have never heard him specifically use the phrase
“smash your head against a wall” to any youth. These staff all
stated they have not heard Supervisor 1 say anything like this to
or away from the youth. These staff all stated they have never
heard Supervisor 1 speak in an aggressive manner toward youth
or use any threatening language toward youth.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed during a face-to-face, announced
visit to the facility on 01/04/2024. He denied using any language
that could have been considered aggressive or threatening
towards any youth during his time working in the program,
specifically and including statements similar to “I’m going to
smash your head against a wall.” He also stated he has talked
with other staff about past experiences working in other similar
programs but that these conversations never contained topics
about harming or threatening youth during those past work
experiences.
2

Staff 5 was interviewed over video conference on 01/09/2024 and
stated he has never heard Supervisor 1 use any threatening
language toward youth in the program.
Youth C, Youth D, Youth E and Youth F were all interviewed
separately over the phone on 01/09/2024. All of the youth stated
they have never heard Supervisor 1 use threatening language
towards themselves or other youth in the program. Youth F did
note that he believed he had heard Supervisor 1 state in a joking
manner that he would “smash you against the wall” to another
youth, but he could not remember who this was or when this may
have occurred. Youth F stated he believed this was joking
because the other youth that he could not specify had stated
something similar and both that youth and Supervisor 1 were
laughing and then the brief interaction ended.
Documentation reviewed:
• A Grievance Form authored by Youth A dated 11/30/2023
was reviewed. This grievance was consistent with the
information provided by Youth A in his interview in that it
was regarding interactions with Supervisor 1 but it did not
contain any concerns about threats or the safety of youth.
• There was no discipline noted in Supervisor 1’s personnel
file.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was not sufficient
evidence found to show that Supervisor 1 has threatened youth
with physical harm.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Public Act 116 722.120 (c) Investigation, inspection, and
Section examination of conditions, books, records, and reports.
Description
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 has falsified documents such as incident reports.
Investigation Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3, and
Supervisor 4, and Supervisor 5 were all interviewed separately
during a face-to-face, announced visit to the facility on
01/04/2024. All staff members reported a similar process that the
facility uses in the writing of Incident Reports. They stated a
Youth Specialist is responsible for authoring the first draft of this
documentation, and they send their copy to a printer in the office.
One of the supervisors on duty then receives the documentation
and they review it and either sign off on it if it is ready to be
completed or provide feedback to the Youth Specialist that
3

authored it. Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 all individually
stated they have authored incident reports that have been
reviewed by Supervisor 1 and have never had concerns that this
information was changed without their consent or falsified in any
way. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 both stated individually that
they have seen Supervisor 1 provide feedback to staff that could
be considered specific, detailed or critical, but also shared that
they have not seen or had concern of Supervisor 1 falsifying
documentation.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed during a face-to-face, announced
visit to the facility on 01/04/2024. He described a similar process
for the writing and review of incident reports. Supervisor 1 denied
that he has ever falsified documentation, nor has he altered the
writing of what was provided to him without discussing it with staff.
He stated he often provides very specific feedback to staff, and
there are times when a document like an incident report has gone
back and forth between him and a staff member before it is ready
to be completed. Supervisor 1 stated at times, he has sat down
next to a staff member who was writing incident reports to provide
feedback and coaching on how it could be completed properly, but
that this never occurred without the staff’s involvement or consent.
Staff 5 was interviewed over video conference on 01/09/2024. He
stated he has authored multiple incident reports that were
reviewed by Supervisor 1. Staff 5 stated Supervisor 1 is very
detailed and can often ask for several changes to a document, but
that this has never resulted in documentation being altered or
falsified in any way.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Institutional Operations” dated
11/28/2022 was reviewed. This described the process of
what is needed for a complete Incident Report and what
steps must be taken to write it and have it approved, all
consistent with staff interviews.
• 20 incident reports that were approved by Supervisor 1
during the month prior to the initiation of this investigation
were reviewed and no concerning elements were noted.
Analysis Through interviews with staff and documentation reviewed there
was not sufficient evidence found to show that Supervisor 1 has
falsified documents at the program.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
